channel.title: The Everyday Muse
channel.description: Follow the ongoing experiment as one author confronts his muse, writing one poem a day for a full year. Each week, we will present the resulting poetry, along with his thoughts on the harnessing or fracture of his creative mind.
channel.itunes:author: Harry Lafnear
channel.itunes:subtitle: An experiment in poetry by Harry Lafnear
channel.itunes:summary: Follow the ongoing experiment as one author confronts his muse, writing one poem a day for a full year. Each week, we will present the resulting poetry, along with his thoughts on the harnessing or fracture of his creative mind.
channel.itunes:keywords: poetry,poems,slam,slam poetry,Collins,Billy Collins,Keillor,Garrison Keillor,writing,writers,writers block,writer's block,Cloudy Day Art,Indiefeed,poetry podcasts,creative writing,muse,Lafnear,Harry,prose,podcasting,unicorns,new,daily,weekly,poem a day

item.title: EDM 140: Tessera
item.description: Poems about the end of summer, the wisdom of childhood, and horsing around in Heaven. Plus part 6 in the Writer's Block saga.
item.itunes:author: Harry Lafnear
item.itunes:subtitle: The end of summer, the wisdom of childhood, and horsing around in Heaven. Plus part 6 in the Writer's Block saga.
item.itunes:summary:
Poems about the end of summer, the wisdom of childhood, and horsing around in Heaven. Plus part 6 in the Writer's Block saga.
Contents: 00:00 Program Introduction 00:55 Writer's Block, Part 6: Frame of Mind 05:40 Oct. 01: "Surrendering September" (prose) 06:20 Oct. 02: "Vigil" (prose) 07:25 Oct. 03: "Following Theater" (prose) 08:25 Oct. 04: "Representing America" (prose) 09:20 Oct. 05: "Straightjacket" (prose) 10:25 Oct. 06: "A Poet's Wish" (prose) 11:15 Oct. 07: "Exploring Heaven" (prose) 12:45 This Week's Lesson: Courting Sleep 13:55 Program Conclusion and Credits
Music provided by Andrea, Audio Imagery, Blake Emrys, Marco Esu, Joy Wants Eternity, and Uma Floresta via PodsafeAudio.com.

item.title: EDM 139: Signals
item.description: Our author discusses the process of creating each podcast, with poems on his home town, love, old photos, and going to Hell.
item.itunes:author: Harry Lafnear
item.itunes:subtitle: Our author talks about creating each podcast, with poems on his home town, love, old photos, and going to Hell.
item.itunes:summary:
Our author discusses the process of creating each podcast, with poems on his home town, love, old photos, and going to Hell.
Contents: 00:00 Program Introduction 00:55 Discussion: Engineering the Show 04:45 Sep. 24: "De Troit" (prose) 05:50 Sep. 25: "The Seed of Substance" (prose) 06:50 Sep. 26: "Squashed" (prose) 08:40 Sep. 27: "Silver" (prose) 10:25 Sep. 28: "How Poetry Thinks" (prose) 11:40 Sep. 29: "Just One More" (prose) 12:40 Sep. 30: "Vestibule" (prose) 13:35 This Week's Lesson: Avoiding Excitement 15:40 Program Conclusion and Credits
Music provided by Audio Imagery, Blake Emrys, Joy Wants Eternity, Torchomatic, and Uma Floresta via PodsafeAudio.com.

item.title: EDM 138: Change of State
item.description: This week's poems start right off with more snails, then meander through world affairs, ghosts, music and more. Also, Part 5 in the series on writer's block.
item.itunes:author: Harry Lafnear
item.itunes:subtitle: Starting with more snails, then world affairs, ghosts, music and more. Also, Part 5 on writer's block.
item.itunes:summary:
This week's poems start right off with more snails, then meander through world affairs, ghosts, music and more. Also, Part 5 in the series on writer's block.
Contents: 00:00 Program Introduction 00:55 Writer's Block, Part 5: Boredom 06:25 Sep. 17: "My Home on My Shoulders" (prose) 08:00 Sep. 18: "Notes on the Contributors" (prose) 09:00 Sep. 19: "The Day the World Changed" (prose) 10:00 Sep. 20: "Gathering Ghosts" (prose) 11:40 Sep. 21: "Flicker" (prose) 12:50 Sep. 22: "What's On?" item.title: EDM 137: Myth
item.description: Another full week, with poems exploring cultural myths on art, childhood, self-image, aliens, and of course, poetry and the muse. Also, Part 4 in the series on writer's block.
item.itunes:author: Harry Lafnear
item.itunes:subtitle: Poems exploring cultural myths on art, childhood, self-image, aliens, and the muse. Also, Part 4 on writer's block.
item.itunes:summary:
Another full week, with poems exploring cultural myths on art, childhood, self-image, aliens, and of course, poetry and the muse. Also, Part 4 in the series on writer's block.
Contents: 00:00 Program Introduction 00:55 Writer's Block, Part 4: Passion, Smassion 06:05 Sep. 10: "The Art of Numbers" (prose) 07:55 Sep. 11: "Dinner Belles" (prose) 09:00 Sep. 12: "The Backward Man" (prose) 10:00 Sep. 13: "Gray Dreams" (prose) 11:10 Sep. 14: "Catering to the Muse" (prose) 12:20 Sep. 15: "Epiphany" (prose) 13:20 Sep. 16: "Passing Between" (prose) 14:35 This Week's Lesson: My Own Medicine 15:15 Program Conclusion and Credits
Music provided by Audio Imagery, Blake Emrys, Joy Wants Eternity, Markovich/AMP, and Uma Floresta via PodsafeAudio.com.

item.title: EDM 136: Hesitation
item.description: Despite some doubts, our author pulls through with another full week of poetry. Topics include nostalgia, ice-cream, asthma, and more.
item.itunes:author: Harry Lafnear
item.itunes:subtitle: Despite doubts, another full week of poetry on nostalgia, ice-cream, asthma, and more.
item.itunes:summary:
Despite some doubts, our author pulls through with another full week of poetry. Topics include nostalgia, ice-cream, asthma, and more.
Contents: 00:00 Program Introduction 00:55 The Old Writers' Curse 02:35 Sep. 03: "Lost Boys" (prose) 04:00 Sep. 04: "Questions for Saturday" (prose) 05:50 Sep. 05: "Frozen" (prose) 07:35 Sep. 06: "Walking Without Direction" (prose) 08:40 Sep. 07: "Kicking Myself" (prose) 09:30 Sep. 08: "Looking" (prose) 10:30 Sep. 09: "Like Breathing" (prose) 11:35 This Week's Lesson: Reluctance 13:20 Program Conclusion and Credits
Music provided by Audio Imagery, Cagey House, DJ Topshelf, Joy Wants Eternity, Markovich/AMP, and Uma Floresta via PodsafeAudio.com.

item.title: EDM 135: Return
item.description: Harry returns after eight weeks dark. A summary of what's happened, and seven new poems.
item.itunes:author: Harry Lafnear
item.itunes:subtitle: Harry returns after eight weeks dark. A summary of what's happened, and seven new poems.
item.itunes:summary:
Harry returns after eight weeks dark. A summary of what's happened, and seven new poems.
Contents: 00:00 Program Introduction 00:55 Why the Show Has Been Dark 03:40 Aug. 27: "Letting Out" (prose) 04:45 Aug. 28: "Perigee" (prose) 05:25 Aug. 29: "Eggshells" (prose) 07:00 Aug. 30: "Bench" (prose) 07:30 Aug. 31: "Always Yes" (verse) 08:30 Sep. 01: "A Thinner Skin" (prose) 09:10 Sep. 02: "Column" (prose) 10:40 This Week's Lesson: Restarting 12:00 Program Conclusion and Credits

item.title: EDM 126: Halfway
item.description: We reach the half-way point in this project, with poems about writing, childhood, history, and art. Plus Part 3 in the discussion of writer's block: Inertia.
item.itunes:author: Harry Lafnear
item.itunes:subtitle: The half-way point. Poems about writing, childhood, history, and art. Plus inertia as a writer's block.
item.itunes:summary:
We reach the half-way point in this project, with poems about writing, childhood, history, and art. Plus Part 3 in the discussion of writer's block: Inertia.
Contents: 00:00 Program Introduction 00:55 Writer's Block, Part 3: Bodies at Rest 04:35 Announcements 06:05 June 25: "Morning Bloom" (prose) 07:25 June 26: "Pillar" (prose) 09:10 June 27: "Left" (prose) 10:20 June 28: "Harvest" (prose) 11:35 June 29: "Exhibit" (prose) 12:25 June 30: "Curating Home" (prose) 13:55 July 01: "A Prayer Informed" by Thom Ingram (guest trade) 20:10 This Week's Lesson: What I've Gained 22:44 Program Conclusion and Credits
Music provided by Audio Imagery, Cagey House, Kaveh, Keith Hillebrandt, Joy Wants Eternity, Torchomatic, and Uma Floresta via PodsafeAudio.com. And from King Benny at KingBennyMusic.com.
